thread.title: Mum's anger after Asda pregnancy tests give THREE false positive results in 10 days - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Mum's anger after Asda pregnancy tests give THREE false positive results in 10 days - Manchester Evening News

author: Charlotte Cox
title: Mum's anger after Asda pregnancy tests give THREE false positive results in 10 days - Manchester Evening News
text:
Mum's anger after Asda pregnancy tests give THREE false positive results in 10 days Rebecca Barratt said: "I dread to think how many other women could have been devastated by this." Share A number of people have complained about Asda's own-brand pregnancy tests Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A mum has been left furious after Asda own-brand pregnancy tests gave her false positive results THREE times over 10 days. 
Rebecca Barratt, 31, says the inaccurate tests caused her distress and worry - and has waited four months for Asda to give her sufficient explanation or a refund. 
Online reviews on Asda’s website support Rebecca’s claims, with 13 users marking it an average one-and-a-half stars out of five. All but one complained of false positive results. 
Rebecca, a designer from Hyde , said: “We already have a toddler and would have been happy to have another child. 
“But there would be health implications with the contraception I’m on so it was also a worry. Reviews of Asda's own-brand pregnancy tests 
“I dread to think how many other women have been devastated by this. Despite my complaints to Asda it’s now four months later and they haven’t given me a proper explanation or a refund.” 
Rebecca took the £9.50 digital test - which comes with a promise of 99pc accuracy - when her period was late last November. Read More Pilot gives cheeky wave after heart-stopping Storm Doris landing at Manchester Airport 
Receiving a positive result, Rebecca double checked with a First Response test, which came back negative. 
Left unsure, Rebecca was referred to the early pregnancy unit at Tameside Hospital where a blood test showed her hCG levels - a hormone that spikes during pregnancy - to be very low, meaning she couldn’t be pregnant. 
When Rebecca’s period still hadn’t arrived a week later, Rebecca did another Asda test, which came back positive. A follow-up Clear Blue test was negative. Reviews on the website for the Asda pregnancy test 
Just to make sure, she carried out a third Asda test the following day, and again it was positive. 
Concerned the hospital may have got it wrong, she returned to the unit, where a blood test and scan confirmed she was not - and never had been - pregnant. 
She added: “The Asda test instructions say they pick up HCG levels of 10mIU/ml or above, but my result was three, so I never should have had a positive result.” Read More Watch the moment Storm Doris nearly blows over two people walking down the street 
“This caused me a lot of worries and health concerns.” 
Rebecca complained to Asda and waited weeks for a response, which came in a letter denying any fault and suggesting ‘the health of the user and the way the kits are used’ could impact the result. 
Unsatisfied with this response, Rebecca has replied with a raft of questions on January 24, and is yet to receive a reply. 
Asda has been approached for comment. Like us on Facebook
